What is the primary advantage of camelid: They can access epitopes that are typically inaccessible to conventional antibodies.
They have a higher affinity for the ACE2 receptor.
They are more effective against bacterial infections.
They can be produced more quickly than traditional antibodies.
What potential therapeutic application d: They could be used as therapeutic agents in immunocompromised patients.
They could replace vaccines for the general population.
They are intended for use in treating bacterial infections.
They are designed to enhance the efficacy of existing monoclonal antibodies.
What was the correlation found between s: Higher somatic hypermutation correlated with broader neutralization.
Lower somatic hypermutation correlated with broader neutralization.
Somatic hypermutation had no effect on neutralization breadth.

Single immunization of a llama with a cocktail of RBD variants.
